title: Behind Closed Doors Batman VR and Mafia 3! - Kinda Funny Gamescast E3 2016
description:
All the games we played and saw day 1 of E3!

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/NoTaxation
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Colin Moriarty, and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

transcript_chunks.text: E3 2016 is happening Kinda Funny is going all out with Let's Plays and reaction videos all week long subscribe now at youtube.com/kindafunnygames to not miss a thing what's up guys welcome to the first ever E3 2016 day one Kinda Funny Gamescast wrapup as always I'm Tim Gettys joined by the coolest dudes in video games Colin Moriarty and Greg Miller Professor Greg Miller Adjunct professor Greg Miller let me tell you about particle physics oh my God it's weird cuz that feels really right I don't like it Greg I don't like them particle purp crew purple crew purple crew pink brown crew over there oh the brown I'll give you the brown thanks I'll give you the Browner oh actually you'll give it to me in the brown I mean I can give you the brown I can give it to you if you want God this sounds nasty figure out is anyways I'm sitting here because I'm lazy and didn't want to get up and sit there so Colin where I normally sit but the more important information is that this is E3 we got

Sounds nasty, figuring out is anyways I'm sitting here because I'm lazy and didn't want to get up and sit there so Colin, where I normally sit. But the more important information is that this is E3; we got to play a bunch of games. E3 here by that I mean I played one game. I was going to say we did play, so yeah, a single game today. We of course worked out of the GameSpot booth today doing the Kinda Funny business that'll be up on youtube.com/kindafunnygames isn't that right, Greg? Yeah, thank you. And uh, while we were doing that, we didn't... we saw we talked to a lot of people about their games, David Cage's Detroit: Become Human (I think his name is), no I heard K heard "Kag" I think he meant David Kagame, but I believe the correct name is David Cage. We talked about a lot of games and then we ended... we had 2 hours to go run around and play things so we all ran around for 2 hours and played stuff tomorrow, Millie (I assume you mean Mike "Milli" Miller), and the next day we're playing a whole bunch of stuff; we're seeing a whole bunch of behind-closed-doors stuff; we're going to tell you all about.

2 hours and played stuff tomorrow. We're seeing a whole bunch of behind closed doors stuff, and we're going to tell you all about that. We're going to tell you what happened behind those closed doors. Did you guys see any behind closed doors stuff today? Yeah, I did too. Well, let's start with you Colin because you're going to be leaving pretty soon for meetings - business meetings and stuff. By business meetings, I mean the yearly Big E3 Jeremy Dunham Morton Steakhouse Extravaganza round-up that's where you get some scoops, you can't talk about but you'll talk about, and then you'll also get us those sweet Rocket League exclusives, which isn't a joke - they're coming. By to let's play tomorrow with some of the exclusives. Well, as you know, Rocket League was one of the ultimate E3 moments, and so we get basically first word of refusal on everything Rocket League. It's true, true. Uh, so uh I saw two games went to

well as you know Rocket League was one of the ultimate columbus moments and so we got basically first WR of refusal on everything Rocket League it's true, true uh so uh I saw two games went to 2K in South Hall which I don't think I went to once last year actually no I did I went right there for YouTube but other than that this I didn't even take an appointment last year other than like some Sony behind closed doors things so it's the first time I even went to a third party publisher at E3 since we were at IGN um and I saw Mafia III and I saw Civilization VI okay now the most important thing to tell you about Mafia III is I had a pee really badly throughout the entire demo but I still I still paid as close attention as I possibly could sure uh it is an open world, is exactly what you think it is, it is an open-world uh sandbox action shooter third person uh it takes place in a version of New Orleans I don't remember the name of it it's not New Orleans kind of like number two um

think it is it is an open world uh sandbox action shooter third person uh it takes place in a version of New Orleans I don't remember the name of it it's not New Orleans kind of like numb3r5 too um and uh it's actually quite Dynamic it reminded me in some small way of Grand Theft Auto IV, which was kind of like the underplayed EA published open World sandbox game that came out in like 2009 maybe it's the game we got like six months before it came out I'll never forget that as long as I live we had to put in that long key to play it I remember yeah it was like it was we I don't know why the **** that game was done so early and then it's never released anyway uh it's cool thematically it's really interesting looks a little bit old a little bit dated I mean obviously there's a marquee titles in this particular genre the most Marquee title of all actually is in the genre Grand Theft Auto 5 and so you have to really do a lot to beat it and I don't think this game is even trying to do that but

this particular genre the most marquee title of all actually is in the genre Grand Theft Auto V and so you have to really do a lot to beat it and I don't think this game is even trying to do that but there's cool systems and mechanics in the game that I really thought were interesting um and uh the one cool thing I like is that so basically you're playing as a black Vietnam War veteran in 1968 um a great time to be a minority exactly and that that plays a lot into the the southern setting yeah basically uh there's a like an Italian white mob and a black mob in the city and the Italian mob uh basically all but uh eviscerates the black mob leaving some sort of revenge story to be taken on um and so you play as this uh Vietnam vet Vietnam War veteran he looks like he's in his mid to late 20s um and what's cool about it is that he has like uh three lieutenants basically that he can take over parts of the city and then give them the parts of the city to take care of but depending on the

"and what's cool about it is that he has like three lieutenants basically that he can take over parts of the city and then give them the parts of the city to take care of but depending on the decisions you make they showed a part of the game where it's like you kind of **** one of your lieutenants over so he actually turns on you completely and you have to you have to kill him um and so there's all these like branching PS in the game that are pretty interesting in that respect that sounds cool um and you like sit you have a sit down with them after you take over part of the city and like they make a pitch as to why like you you get like you give them the city or whatever so one of them is like a black woman who's like a native I think of the city one of them is like a like an Irish dude who's like a mobster and one of them is an Italian mobster who is like betraying um uh I I was I was hands off gotcha they CH they chose the Italian dude and then the Irish guy actually turned"

dude who's like a mobster and one of them is an Italian mobster who is like betraying uh I was hands off gotcha they chose the Italian dude and then the Irish guy actually turned on us and showed it showed us like he's like not everyone's going to see this but you you go to his like compound which is like a steel mill or something and you like kill all his men and stuff like that so there's like it is super rife with things to do um and that sounds great I I like that about Mafia too I like and I like the little parts you're talking about I can deal with it not being on Grand Theft Auto's level it's definitely not but I mean maybe it is I mean I haven't played it but I mean just aesthetically and stuff like that but there's a ton of **** to do one of the cool things I like and this reminded me a lot of Godfather 2 in some sense as well was um your the entire idea of a lot of the things you're doing in the

but there's a ton of work to do, one of the cool things I like, and this reminded me a lot of The Godfather II in some sense as well. Was um, you're the entire idea of a lot of the things you're doing in the game is to whittle down the resources of your rivals you have in the city, and there's like a bunch of them kind of... um so like it shows you how much money they're making and everything you do in the game whittles down the amount of money they're making until it's down to zero. So like you can go after like their drug runner, you can go after like the guy who like launders their money or you can like go burn down like their facility where they make drugs or whatever and then that money totally whittles down to zero and once it's whittled down to zero, looks like you take over that part of the city. Then you give it to one of your people and then you go about your business. So it is very, it is very step by step in that respect and there's a whole story throughout it as well.

of the city, then you give it to one of your people, and then you go about your business. So it is very step by step in that respect, and there's a whole story throughout it as well. As for the three - the Italian, the Irish, and the other one, the black woman - they're the ones that are like with you, and then there are like rival gangs or different gangs that you're trying to kind of screw around. So they show you going into a brothel, and this guy is getting a uh laugh dance by this woman. You kind of stealth in and shoot him in the head, and it says like $10,000 whatever on the thing or whatever, and you get money. And then it whitts down the money, and then you get out of there. Um, and so it's kind of cool - I can see myself getting into

on the thing or whatever and you like get money and then like it whittles down the money and then you get out of there um and so it's kind of cool like I I can see myself kind of kind of getting into that seems like there's a lot of collectibles and stuff like that I mean it looks interesting um I'm definitely going to play it October 7th I think that comes out awesome and then Civilization VI, Civilization VI uh you know so Civilization V I am not by any respect an OG Civ fan I didn't get into Civilization at all until V um and I really loved V I still think Civilization V is probably one of the games I played the most of in my entire life and by hours played I played that game for **** ever um or what felt like forever I mean who the **** knows you were playing on a PC so it could have been 15 minutes it always I just remember I just remember for I remember what seems like I I've gone back to it many times in the past or several times in the past but I remember what feels like like several months

it always I just remember I just remember for I remember what seems like several months of me just sitting on the couch with the mouse on my laptop on the armrest just playing it while I was watching TV I don't think I played anything else when that game came out for a while on like multiple accounts I think because I just I think I downloaded it like multiple times too I think I just bought it again like last year um so um because I have no idea how to use Steam so um that's how it works anytime you want to play a PC game you buy it again buy it again so there are little tweaks I don't I don't know that I even recognize all of them being not an OG Civ fan but there like you can like layer troops on top of each other now on tiles which is pretty cool you can start to make like settlements around your cities so like it's basically

not an OG's uh Civ fan but there like you can like layer troops on top of each other now on tiles which is pretty cool you can start to make like settlements around your cities so like it's basically spreading the game out a little bit which is pretty cool the entire video they show which is like 15 or 20 minutes which is basically someone playing and narrating showing you like how your civilization obviously grows from like the embryonic animal husbandry and agriculture stage to like space um which is the entire idea of the game and that's one of the ways you can obviously win in Civilization so um it looks cool Enhanced Graphics battles are cool what's great about Civilization is the asymmetric way that you and other civilizations around you grow and so at the end they showed um Egypt invading your country and your China and this and obviously people that know Civilization know you can pick your leader and then you get like all these benefits and perks um they

they showed um Egypt invading your country and your China and this and obviously people that know civilization know you can pick your leader and then you get like all these benefits and perks um they invade uh Egypt invades China but China's like way more technologically advanced than them so they Counterattack and so it's basically like tanks and airplanes fighting against like people on Horseback so these are the kinds of things so these are the kinds of things that you can get I mean like you can reach as people know and like you can get reach the Renaissance in like 1100 and you can reach like the space a like, 1600 if you really play it really well you know like so it doesn't necessarily have to make any sense um so a lot of that seems to be intact it looks **** awesome also comes out in October super excited about it um met someone from the developer for the first time too and and chatted just for a brief moment with him um so both games look cool 2K has got a lot of cool
